Draft definition: Enter name of the organisation carrying out the procurement
Maps to: Project Level: Add an entry to ``parties`` with 'procuringEntity' included in its ``.roles`` | Contracting process: Record the name and identifier in ``contractingProcesses.procuringEntity``
Project Level: Publish the postal address as ``parties.address`` and the electronic address in ``parties.contactPoint``

Draft definition: Enter name of the organisation carrying out the contract administrative entity if different from the Procuring Entity
Maps to: Project Level: Add an entry to ``parties`` with 'administativeEntity' included in its ``.roles`` | Contracting process: Record the name and identifier in ``contractingProcesses.administrativeEntity``

Draft definition: Select from pre-award, active or closed
Maps to: Contracting process: Publish as ``contractingProcesses.status`` using the processStatus codelist.

Draft definition: Develop a list such as International Competitive Bidding, National Competitive Bidding, Donor Procurement Rules, Framework, Direct Award
Maps to: Contracting process: Publish as ``contractingProcesses.procurementMethodDetails`` and map to ``contractingProcesses.procurementMethod``.

Draft definition: Develop a list such as Design, Supervision, Design & Supervision, Design & Build, Construction
Maps to: Contracting process: Add one or more values to the ``contractingProcesses.focus`` array. (e.g. ['design','build'] for a design and build contract).

Draft definition: Number of firms who submit a tender
Currency and amount of the original pre-tender estimate of the contract
The formal name of the contract

Maps to: Project Level: Add an entry to ``parties`` with 'supplier' included in its ``.roles`` | Contracting process: Record the name and identifier in ``contractingProcesses.suppliers`` array

Draft definition: Currency and price at contract award
Main outputs from the contract e.g. detailed design, supervision, project management and or type, quantity, unit for construction
Maps to: Contracting process: Publish as ``contractingProcesses.description``. Additionally detailed documentation may be provided as documents within linked releases.

CoST IDS Element: Contract start date and contract period (duration)
Draft definition: Enter dates and Number of weeks from contract start date to (anticipated) completion date
Difference between the price at contract award and the current projected price
Maps to: Contracting process > Release List: For each variation, publish an entry with a description and reason in ``variations.price`` .

Draft definition: Escalation to date of the price of materials, labour, equipment etc. due to fluctuations in inflation, currency etc.
Maps to: ``variations.price.description`` should indicate clearly that this change represents an increase, and ``variations.price.reason`` should explain the reasons for the variation.

Draft definition: Difference between original duration at contract award and the current projected duration in weeks.
Maps to: Contracting process > Release List: For each variation, publish an entry with a description and reason in ``variations.duration`` .

Draft definition: Any changes between original scope at contract award and the current scope
Maps to: Contracting process > Release List: For each variation, publish an entry with a description and reason in ``variations.scope`` .

Draft definition: Summary of reasons for primary of changes (e.g. variations) that then lead to changes in contract price, major price fluctuations and accumulative increase or decrease in price.
Maps to: Contracting process > Release List: For each variation, publish an entry with a description and reason in ``variations.price`` .

CoST IDS Element: Reasons for scope and duration changes
Draft definition: Summary of reasons for primary of changes (e.g. variations) that then lead to changes in the scope and duration.
Maps to: Contracting process > Release List: For each variation, publish an entry with a description and reason in ``variations.scope`` or ``variations.duration`` .
